items.title: Guidance: Taking part in the UK Emissions Trading Scheme markets
items.summary: This guidance explains the operation of the UK ETS markets and how to take part in auctions and in trading on the secondary market.

items.title: Independent report: Impacts of minimum wages: review of the international evidence
items.summary: An independent report on the impacts of minimum wages, to inform the UK government’s decisions on the remit of the Low Pay Commission beyond 2020.

items.title: Guidance: Subsidy Control Act 2022: Streamlined Routes
items.summary: Streamlined Routes (also known as Streamlined Subsidy Schemes) are a type of subsidy scheme made by the UK government for use by any UK public authority.

items.title: Promotional material: Employment Rights Act 2025: factsheets
items.summary: Further details on the measures included within the Employment Rights Act 2025.

items.title: Transparency data: DESNZ non-consolidated performance related pay, 2024 to 2025
items.summary: Information on non-consolidated performance related pay data for the Department for Energy Security and Net Zero (DESNZ).

items.title: Transparency data: DESNZ non-consolidated performance related pay, 2023 to 2024
items.summary: Information on non-consolidated performance related pay data for the Department for Energy Security and Net Zero (DESNZ).

items.title: Guidance: Capture Redress Scheme: independent panel and panel chair privacy notice
items.summary: How the Capture Redress Scheme independent panel and the panel chair  will process your personal data.

items.title: Oil and gas: offshore environmental legislation
items.summary: Environmental regulations and guidance on offshore oil and gas exploration and production offshore gas unloading and storage and offshore carbon dioxide storage activities

items.title: Oil and gas: environmental submissions and determinations
items.summary: Interested parties can review records of applications and statements submitted to OPRED as required by environmental regulations.

items.title: Research: Climate transition and global financial stability: literature review
items.summary: A review of the current literature and evidence on the impact of climate risk on global financial stability, particularly in Emerging Market and Developing Economies.

items.title: Stronger parental leave rights to give millions of working families the “security they deserve”
items.summary: New day one rights to parental leave set to enter force from April.

items.title: Statutory guidance: Code of practice: industrial action ballots and notice to employers
items.summary: Practical guidance to trade unions and employers to promote the improvement of industrial relations and good practice in the conduct of trade union industrial action ballots.

items.title: Guidance: Code of practice: picketing
items.summary: Guidance on picketing for employers, workers or members of the public who may be affected by a picket or any associated activities.

items.title: Statutory guidance: Picketing: draft revised code of practice
items.summary: The revised code of practice on picketing provides practical guidance on picketing in trade disputes, updated following the Employment Rights Act 2025.

items.title: Statutory guidance: Industrial action ballots and notice to employers: draft revised code of practice
items.summary: Guidance promoting the improvement of industrial relations and good practice in conducting industrial action ballots, revised post-Employment Rights Act 2025.

items.title: Research: Steel public procurement 2026
items.summary: Government departments’ steel procurement data, in compliance with the steel procurement guidance, including the UK government steel requirements for the next 10 years.

items.title: Guidance: Contributing to the IPCC
items.summary: This page contains guidance for UK experts on how they can contribute to the United Nations’ Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC).

items.title: Notice: IPCC Methodology Report on Inventories for Short-lived Climate Forcers: expert review
items.summary: The Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC) has announced an expert review of its 'Methodology Report on Inventories for Short-lived Climate Forcers'.

items.title: Policy paper: Backing your business: our plan for small and medium-sized businesses
items.summary: Strategy setting out a long-term plan for government support for small and medium-sized businesses.

items.title: Corporate Power Purchase Agreements
items.summary: This call for evidence seeks views on how to improve the GB Corporate Power Purchase Agreement market.

items.title: Corporate Power Purchase Agreements
items.summary: This call for evidence seeks views on how to improve the GB Corporate Power Purchase Agreement market.

items.title: Notice: Heat Pump Ready Programme: successful projects
items.summary: Projects awarded under Stream 1, Stream 2 and Stream 3 of the Heat Pump Ready Programme, part of the £1 billion Net Zero Innovation Portfolio.

items.title: Guidance: Horizon Shortfall Scheme Appeals (HSSA): tariff of reasonable legal costs
items.summary: This guidance sets out the legal costs we will cover for Horizon Shortfall Scheme Appeals (HSSA) applicants.

items.title: Transparency data: UKAEA prompt payment return data from 2025 to 2026
items.summary: Prompt payment return data for the UK Atomic Energy Authority, showing invoices paid within 5 and 30 days of receipt from 2025 to 2026.

items.title: Trade union law: transition to Employment Rights Act 2025
items.summary: Transitional and saving arrangements for the trade union measures of the Employment Rights Act 2025 coming into force on 18 February 2026: for employers, unions and workers.

items.title: Policy paper: Orkney Transmission Link project: contingent liability
items.summary: Proposal for a capped contingent liability regarding a policy indemnity to Scottish and Southern Electricity Networks Transmission (SSENT) for the Orkney Transmission Link project.

items.title: Decision: East Anglia THREE Offshore Wind Farm: post-consent condition discharge, Planning Act 2008
items.summary: Decision by the Secretary of State on an application by East Anglia THREE Limited under the Planning Act 2008.

items.title: UK Sustainability Reporting Standards
items.summary: Information on the UK government’s framework to create UK Sustainability Reporting Standards (UK SRS) by assessing and endorsing the global corporate reporting baseline of IFRS Sustainability Disclosure Standards.

items.title: Accredited official statistics: Energy Trends: UK renewables
items.summary: Data on the UK’s renewables sector, including capacity, electricity generation and liquid biofuels consumption.

items.title: Official Statistics: Average road fuel sales, deliveries and stock levels
items.summary: Official statistics in development on average road fuel sales, deliveries and stock levels

items.title: Notice: Trade remedies notice: definitive anti-dumping duty on certain engine oils and hydraulic fluids originating from Lithuania and the United Arab Emirates
items.summary: The Secretary of State for Business and Trade is applying a definitive anti-dumping duty on certain engine oils and hydraulic fluids originating from Lithuania and the UAE.

items.title: Start a new job: step by step
items.summary: What to do when starting a job: checks your employer may do, employment contracts, what to do with your P45 or starter checklist.

items.title: Notice: Direct Air Capture and Greenhouse Gas Removal Innovation Programme: selected projects
items.summary: This competition provides funding for developing technologies that enable the removal of greenhouse gases from the atmosphere in the UK.

items.title: Notice: Low Carbon Hydrogen Supply 2 competition: successful projects
items.summary: The Low Carbon Hydrogen Supply Competition aimed to provide funding for projects that could help develop a wide range of innovative low-carbon hydrogen supply solutions.

items.title: Employment Rights Act 2025: impact assessments
items.summary: Impact assessments and analytical documents relating to the Employment Rights Act 2025.

items.summary: This paper sets out the legal and economic implications of the Employment Rights Act 2025.

items.title: Guidance: Training on export control compliance
items.summary: Courses, seminars, workshops and webinars to help exporters understand their obligations under export control legislation.

items.title: Impact assessment: National Policy Statements for energy: habitats regulations assessments
items.summary: A habitats regulations assessment is required for proposed plans or projects likely to have a significant effect on international sites of scientific interest.

items.summary: The likely significant sustainability effects of developing new energy infrastructure of the types covered by the National Policy Statements for energy.
